rev.desc.rev.desc: devtx I3323
Added the following expression to panel add.level.to.list, to allow for correct spreading characteristics:
$L.array.tmp=$L.array.tmp.next
devtx I2743
Added the following expressions to panel add.level.to.list, to prevent continued processing if a duplicate array is encountered:
if (index($L.array.tmp.next, $L.arrays.completed)>0) then ($L.stop=true)
$L.arrays.completed=insert($L.arrays.completed, 1, 1, $L.array.tmp.next)
devtx I1631
the message saying that the max hits was being reached was being sent more than 1 time.
panel: decide.stop
Inserted a new exit at the top:
exit: exit.normal
condition: $L.count>=$L.max
Now the message will be sent as soon as the count has reached the max (sent only 1 time). The application will then exit because there is no point in continuing since the max hits has been reached.
panels: add.to.next.temp and build.qry
swapped the logic on the if statements so that if the mode is 'up' the query and the array are built using the logical.name field and if it's 'down' the query is built using the related.cis field.
no changes
changed anything referring to deviceparent to reference the new cirelationship table. Updated the sql strings to include the fields from the cirelationship table instead.
Modified panel add.to.next.temp so that $L.array.tmp.next is properly built to support both "up" and "down" modes.
Spread of outages did not extend to children of 2nd+ CI's in 1st-level... rewritten to support complete spread.
Will no longer add a device name to the array of devices if it is already there.
panel: deviceparent.select
changed exit if one record found to 'set.stop.flag'. Query was looping incorrectly and finding more records than it should have.
Converted to use scmsg().
Can now return an array of logical names instead of a query. Needed this functionality for efficient SLA processing.
Can now search for only physical or only logical relationships
Also, will now return "false" instead of "logical.name isin {}"

descript.descript: devtx I3323
Added the following expression to panel add.level.to.list, to allow for correct spreading characteristics:
$L.array.tmp=$L.array.tmp.next
devtx I2743
Added the following expressions to panel add.level.to.list, to prevent continued processing if a duplicate array is encountered:
if (index($L.array.tmp.next, $L.arrays.completed)>0) then ($L.stop=true)
$L.arrays.completed=insert($L.arrays.completed, 1, 1, $L.array.tmp.next)
devtx I1631
the message saying that the max hits was being reached was being sent more than 1 time.
panel: decide.stop
Inserted a new exit at the top:
exit: exit.normal
condition: $L.count>=$L.max
Now the message will be sent as soon as the count has reached the max (sent only 1 time). The application will then exit because there is no point in continuing since the max hits has been reached.
panels: add.to.next.temp and build.qry
swapped the logic on the if statements so that if the mode is 'up' the query and the array are built using the logical.name field and if it's 'down' the query is built using the related.cis field.
no changes
changed anything referring to deviceparent to reference the new cirelationship table.
Modified panel add.to.next.temp so that $L.array.tmp.next is properly built to support both "up" and "down" modes.
Spread of outages did not extend to children of 2nd+ CI's in 1st-level... rewritten to support complete spread.
Will no longer add a device name to the array of devices if it is already there.
panel: deviceparent.select
changed exit if one record found to 'set.stop.flag'. Query was looping incorrectly and finding more records than it should have.
Converted to use scmsg().
Can now return an array of logical names instead of a query. Needed this functionality for efficient SLA processing.
Can now search for only physical or only logical relationships
Also, will now return "false" instead of "logical.name isin {}"
